tags: None
review: Doctis very experienced and explained all the issues. I had a few questions which he answered politely. He also gave me tops and suggestions on gum and teeth care. The scaling and polishing procedure were completed without any hassle. Overall very good experience.
reply_text: Thanks very much for your kind words

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I went to sir because i had swollen gums on the upper left side of my jaw. He was very friendly and explanatory. Even during lockdown when i called him, he prescribed me medicine without asking for any charge and when i visited him after lockdown, he suggested me to remove my wisdom teeth and i went by his suggestion. I am really satisfied since the treatment. The procedure was extremely smooth and it didn't even pain while he gave me the anesthesia injection which was one of my biggest fears. He also took necessary precautions like measuring the temperature and oxygen, gave me hand gloves and hairnet in this pandemic situation.Thank you sir for treating my problem so well.
reply_text: thank you so much for your words of appreciation. thanks a lot.

tags: None
review: I had visited Smilecare Dental Clinic about 2 months back for some dental fillings. Upon checking, doctor diagnosed four cavities in my mandibular posterior teeth for which I was getting mild pain and sensitivity.  I had to undergo one root canal treatment and three cosmetic fillings. * **** ***** ****  ****** *** ** ********* *** ** he not only did rct in a single sitting but also the fillings were absolutely invisible,quite unlike my old metal fillings which have turned black. I even plan to get those old fillings with tooth colored ones. Thank you doctor.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: We have visited Dr. Deepan Chandra on 17th July this year for filling three teeth. He made the filling and overcharged us for that 7.5k. We were shocked **** *** **** ****** ***** we had to pay so much.   In this period of pandemic to be overcharged  like that is really tough. Nonetheless we payed, thought may be the quality must be good. But in two days the filling of two teeth came out. On 09th October we called the doctor and he gave us an appointment on the same day. When we came we talked him the reason of our visit and I requested him just redo only those teeth where the filling fall out. He said that there is one more tooth nearby with cavity so I agreed to make cavity treatment of that too. When the work was done he on his own applied sum gel on the teeth which cost 3k. Overall he charged us 8k. Even for the teeth that he fill so badly he charged us again. I tried to explain that at this period of life with pandemic for us to be overcharged is difficulty he did not pay any attention to our words and we had no any other way to pay his bill. So, who ever is going to visit the doctor my suggestion first ask him how much he is going to charge you, so you shall not be in a position where we have been.
reply_text:
You are wrong. You were charged exactly at par with the industry standards for the materials used for your treatment. 
During the pandemic you should know that the dentists have to bear huge overhead costs to run clinic as per WHO & CDC guidelines. So, it is obvious that the treatment charges have gone up much higher in this  period. 
You were charged only for the new cavities that were restored. 
Moreover the fluoride gel application was done only after informing you after you demanded anticavity preventive therapy.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
I have booked schedule for 11:30Am but got a call from doctor to come at 10:30Am I reached at 10:25 and wait more then 2 hours. Seriously I feel irritated. When doctor saw my wisdom teeth directly suggest me to extraction of teeth because of no space and tell me abt cost rs 10,000 and one another surgeon will come on his clinic for this work, but when I visited another hospital they suggested me don't extract your wisdom teeth because u have proper space in your mouth and it is not harmful for other teeth and now a day I feel very ok without extraction of teeth
Please think once.
reply_text:
Mr. Kumar,I am sorry you had to wait on  your appointment date because I was engaged in one emergency surgery for another patient. 
Secondly, regarding your case, myself being a specialist periodontal surgeon, I feel it is an absolute must to get your wisdom tooth extracted surgically considering its position inside your jaw and the degree of pericoronitis and associated gum infection you were suffering from because of that impacted wisdom tooth. Your pain has subsided only temporarily because of the antibiotics and painkillers which were prescribed. But I repeat that this is only a temporary relief and the pain will occur with more severity anytime in near future and it will be a recurrent chronic problem if you don't get that impacted wisdom tooth extracted. 
SURGICAL EXTRACTION OF THE IMPACTED WISDOM TOOTH IS THE ONLY PERMANENT SOLUTION TO YOUR PROBLEM. 
This is my opinion being a specialist in this field and having more than 10 years of experience in seeing and handling such cases. 
However, other doctors might have their own opinion too for which I am not really bothered and concerned about.

tags: None
review: Me and my wife visited  Dr. Chandra for several problems like tooth loss and large gaps between teeth. I must admit that Dr. Chandra is very warm and courteous, with excellent communication skills . He gave a patient hearing to our problems and explained to us all possible treatment modalities. * **** *** ****  *** ****** *** ****** ******** ******* He literally fixed my lost teeth in the best possible way through implant supported crowns and bridges,which not only resembles my natural teeth but also helping me chew  everything just like my natural teeth. Now I can enjoy my food  to my utmost satisfaction. My wife had large gaps between her upper front teeth because of which she could not smile properly and was lacking in self confidence. *** *******  *** ** ********* ******** ***  ** ** ****** ***** *** **** *** * ***** ********* ***** **** ****. We both are extremely satisfied with our treatment and would definitely recommend Dr. Deepan and Smilecare Dental Clinic to everyone.

tags: None
review:
Really friendly doctor, first explained to me the problem and how the process is to be done, completely painless treatment, plus the price was much less than other clinics in the area and the treatment was completed in just one sitting.
I would also like to mention that unlike most doctors Dr. Chandra was on time and didn't have to wait even a minute for my appointment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,
review: The doctor is prompt in tracking the root cause of the issue. The doctor also has focused approach. The clinic was clean and has good waiting lounge.

tags: None
review: I had visited Dr. Chandra as I was suffering occasional pain in my teeth especially while chewing food. Dr. Chandra did single sitting  root canal treatment on two of my teeth. I must say that the whole procedure was absolutely painless. It was beyond my expectation. Before  this I had a wrong notion that root canal treatment is really painful and requires multiple visits. But now I have been proved wrong. I am very much satisfied with the treatment I got. Dr. Chandra is a very good clinician.

tags: None
review: I visited Dr. chandra for pain in my gum. Instead of giving me solution to my pain he started promoting on getting my teeth aligned which would cost me rs.70,000.00. He charged me rs.500.00 instead of 300.00 as mentioned in practo for the consultation. I went to a different doc for second opinion and she fixed my pain with merely 200 rs consultation with 95 rs antibiotic and 54 rs antispectic mouth gel. Very bad experience with Dr.Chandra.
reply_text:
Mr. Arijit, you came with the problem of recurrent swelling and pain in the upper incisive papilla region of your palatal gum tissue. I noticed you have an extremely deep bite in the anterior region of mouth, your upper central incisors are rotated inwards and your lower incisors are intruded. That is why everytime  when you are biting, the edges of your lower incisors are impinging on the opposing gum tissue at the incisive papilla region of your palate. This constant trauma on the gum tissue is causing recurrent swelling and pain in that region. In no way any antibiotic or any antiseptic gel is going to give you a permanent cure or solution to your problem until and unless your anterior deep bite is corrected and your teeth are aligned properly. Medicines and ointments will only give you stopgap or temporary relief from pain, but it will again recur for sure. So anterior deep bite correction is of prime importance for you for a permanent solution to your problem.
Regarding consultation fees, I have done selective grinding with respect to your lower incisors for which I have charged Rs.200 over and above my consultation fees of Rs. 300. So the cumulative total fees charged from you was Rs. 500. My consultation fees is always Rs. 300 as shown in Practo. So please don't suffer from any misconceptions.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: The doctor went for an extraction without doing any xray or any pre extraction medicines ***** ** ********** ** ***** * **** ****** *** ********** He gave the anaesthetic injection and went straight for removing the tooth without waiting for it to take effect. My dad was in excruciating pain and we had to abort the procedure *** ** **** ***** *** **** ***** ** ** ********* ** *** ***** ***** ****** ********* ****** *** ***********
reply_text: First of all, there is no need of an Xray before doing a routine normal extraction of a tooth or root stump, especially so there is no extra oral swelling or draining sinus or a history of long standing infection, neither there is any hard and fast rule that medicines need to be prescribed at least 2 days before the extraction procedure. However, the threshold of pain tolerance differs from patient to patient, which is not possible to ascertain before any dental procedure, especially dental surgeries. That's why even after administering considerable amount of anaesthesia, some patients may still experience pain while someone else may not feel any pain. In such cases it is perfectly normal to abort the procedure for the time being and wait for few days. This is NOT A FAULT ON THE PART OF THE DOCTOR.

tags: Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,
review: The filling was not properly done, I went to him again to fix it the other day,  then later after seven or eight days it came off. He didn't mention the filling was of no guarantee and when I informed about my filling he said I have to pay to fix it again. He took Rs. 1500 for the filling and Rs. 300 for the consultant fee. Don't recommend at all.
reply_text:
Hello you visited me with a fractured tooth..upper central incisor angle fracture. Not with any complaints of pain. I rebuilt the fractured central incisor with composite resin material. Let me tell you that there is no guarantee for any filling anywhere especially for reconstruction of angle fracture in anterior  tooth. You must have applied some shearing force on  your front tooth by biting on something hard which I instructed you to strictly avoid. That abrupt force application has resulted in the filling being dislodged. In no way is the dentist responsible for this. 
Rebuilding an angle fracture in front tooth is off course chargeable because it involves a lot of skill, labour, manual dexterity on the part of the dentist as well as expensive materials which is required.
